name: thedailybeast
text: “I wasn’t trying to troll them, but it felt like I did,” Kondabolu continues. “They’re not supposed to respond to me. That’s an indication that you couldn’t handle the criticism…It’s really kinda shitty.” https://t.co/IzHF2Z3DWx

name: thedailybeast
text:
What else does he think is a “crock of shit”? Undecided voters.

“If you are undecided a month out, after four years?” he asks, expressing his disdain for the president. “What needed to happen short of ’Donald Trump came to my house and killed my family?’” https://t.co/IzHF2Z3DWx

name: thedailybeast
text: But things aren’t all about death and destruction in the Kondabolu household. The touring stand-up comedian just welcomed his first child over the summer… during a deadly pandemic that’s forced him to be not touring. https://t.co/IzHF2Z3DWx

name: thedailybeast
text:
“If fate is like, we gotta make sure he has time with his baby—at the expense of hundreds of thousands of people—then fate is fucked up,” he says.

Listen to @harikondabolu's full interview with @mattwilstein on #TheLastLaugh here: https://t.co/IzHF2Z3DWx

name: thedailybeast
text: “Trump would say outrageous things, or say things that weren’t true, and it just became accepted as, ‘Oh, that’s what he does.’ Not calling that out more for what it was, and then holding the other side more accountable, that was probably a mistake.” https://t.co/fm0Ko4TTrs

name: thedailybeast
text: Trump wants to use his NBC event—running alongside Biden’s ABC one—to embarrass his rival in TV ratings numbers. NBC staffers worry the network is playing directly into his hands. https://t.co/aFuocu4MYT

name: thedailybeast
text: RT @MarlowNYC: Ice Cube has graduated from anti-Semite to Trump collaborator... yikes https://t.co/RuAFGduNsw

name: thedailybeast
text: President Trump’s advisers expressed concern for the U.S. economy in private briefings with major Republican donors while the president was telling the public the new coronavirus was “very much under control” https://t.co/KCBGQ2DEte
